question: If the cost price of 12 apples is equal to the selling price of 10 apples, what is the profit percentage?
A train 150 meters long is running at 45 km/h. How long will it take to cross a man standing on the platform?
Find the value of x if 3x + 5 = 20.
If 12 men can finish a work in 18 days, how many days will 9 men take to finish it?
The average of five consecutive odd numbers is 35. What is the highest number?
A sum of ₹5000 amounts to ₹6000 in 2 years at simple interest. What is the rate of interest?
A boat goes 15 km downstream in 1.5 hours and returns in 3 hours. What is the speed of the stream?
The difference between the simple and compound interest on ₹10,000 at 10% per annum for 2 years is:
Two numbers are in the ratio 3:5. If their sum is 64, what is the larger number?
A sum of ₹12,000 is divided into two parts such that one part is invested at 5% and the other at 10% per annum. The total annual interest is ₹800. What is the amount invested at 10%?
If the perimeter of a rectangle is 80 cm and its length is 30 cm, what is its width?
The average of 15 numbers is 25. If each number is increased by 5, what will be the new average?
If selling price = ₹720 and profit percentage = 20%, what is the cost price?
